instruction: Given an Amazon review, indicate whether it is a 'Positive Review' or 'Negative Review'.
input:
I bought this for my wife and she lives with it between charges. That is my only complaint. With a lot of stuff running it only lasts 8 hours ±.
The size is a little unwieldy using the forward facing camera. Skyping is good and the Netflix quality is superb . After two years of use I would buy it again.

instruction: Given an Amazon review, indicate whether it is a 'Positive Review' or 'Negative Review'.
input: We had the standard 4 cell battery for the Dell Mini 910, but after a years of use it didn't hold its charge for very long. Seeing this product's price and that it was an 8-cell, I thought this would be great. Initially, it performed only as well as a 4-cell batter (3-4 hours of use), but I figure this is what you get not buying the official dell battery. Now after only a couple months, as soon as I unplug, battery light starts flashing.  Avoid this product!

instruction: Given an Amazon review, indicate whether it is a 'Positive Review' or 'Negative Review'.

instruction: Given an Amazon review, indicate whether it is a 'Positive Review' or 'Negative Review'.
input: Just a short note. Installed a 240gb Sandisk Extreme SSD in my mid 09 Mac Book Pro, 2.26ghz(doing the firmware upgrade r211m for 3.0 gb speed), and all is very well. Pleased both with the price and with the performance of this SSD. Not a hitch or a glitch. Recommended.

instruction: Given an Amazon review, indicate whether it is a 'Positive Review' or 'Negative Review'.
input: What a fantastic display! It is hard to find a nice monitor with a height adjustable stand for a decent price. I was long overdue for an upgrade and was previously using a 19\\" Gateway LCD from 2000. Although the product description does not say it, it is HDCP compatible. My new computer has a Blu-Ray drive that would not play movies using my old monitor. The movies I tried after receiving this monitor look awesome. Also, I am happy with the bezel. It is not shiny and fat like some of the monitors out there. Best of all cables (VGA and DVI) are included.

instruction: Given an Amazon review, indicate whether it is a 'Positive Review' or 'Negative Review'.
input:
We gave this to my daughter for Christmas and it was a huge hit. It was easy to learn to use. I will say there are things that are easier to do on a computer than on the Kindle. Some things...such as the Amazon site, has such small tabs that even with a stylist it is hard to click on the right thing.

Other than that one tiny thing....Awesome so far! I would recommend it to anyone as a first or low cost tablet choice. It does everything the "big guys" do.

instruction: Given an Amazon review, indicate whether it is a 'Positive Review' or 'Negative Review'.
input:
The hardware is great, nice machine.

However, the operating system is defective...IT HAD WINDOWS 8!

I HATE WINDOWS 8.

I hated it so much I returned the laptop. This made me sad because it is a beautiful machine, but Win8 is a heaping pile of dung!

I really hope multiple people at Microsoft lose their jobs over the disaster that is Win8. I have never wanted an apple until now. I have always been an advocate for Windows over apple, but now I have to reconsider...well, not really. I would never buy anything from apple. Now, I am questioning if I ever want to give Microsoft my business again.

AVOID WIN8. It is too great a departure from what windows is supposed to be, and Microsoft is using apple tactics. They are trying to trap their users and control every aspect of their electronic experience.

I hope someone will develop an open platform that has quality features. The thing that made Windows great is it use to give you maximum freedom and choices. It gave you control and flexibility over your equipment. It was easy to use, and easy to figure out.

Maybe Win 8 is easy too, but it is so different that you can't find your way around by using what you already know about Win7. You have to learn everything all over again. WASTE OF TIME!

I do not reward stupidity, do you hear that Microsoft! You should have made a product that will make your users happy, not one that irritates them! I wasted almost a month on your lame OS, and I ended up returning it. I hope you choke on all of the win8 returns you get. Some heads better roll for this.

instruction: Given an Amazon review, indicate whether it is a 'Positive Review' or 'Negative Review'.
input: Can't beat it for the money. This has been a terrific product. It's running a webserver with MySQL no problem. The only bottleneck is the slow storage, but you buy this item knowing that SD cards are NEVER going to be as fast as sata-connectors. Fine, price is right, way fun.

instruction: Given an Amazon review, indicate whether it is a 'Positive Review' or 'Negative Review'.
input: After considering scores of cases for the IPad, I decided on this one as it combined both the keypad and a protective cover. I was already using a \\"stock\\" IPad cover from the Apple Store I had ordered along with the IPad, as well as an Apple keyboard; both of which worked well by themselves. This product combines the best of both worlds. This a great utiitarian and space saving accessory for a frequent traveler such as myself.   The constrction is very solid, great pading for protection and good ergonomic design for typing. No problems in set up or bluetooth connectivity.

instruction: Given an Amazon review, indicate whether it is a 'Positive Review' or 'Negative Review'.
input: When you read the reviews it seems that 1 in 5 doesn't work. Of course, I got the 1 that doesn't work. Followed all the directions, nothing happened.  I tried and tried.  All the while my husband saying that I should have bought an apple product (at 3 X the price)!  Since I bought mine on eBay, no way to return it, it was a $9 wash!  Went to the apple store, bought the apple product, and it worked beautifully!

instruction: Given an Amazon review, indicate whether it is a 'Positive Review' or 'Negative Review'.

Both the keyboard and the mouse arrived damaged -- a tweaked key on the board and the mouse right clicker was completely non functional which made it randomly click/select and delete some of my computer files. Big headache. This might have been an OK item had it not arrived broken. Now I have the joy of returning the item. They need to check the quality before it ships out.

instruction: Given an Amazon review, indicate whether it is a 'Positive Review' or 'Negative Review'.
input: When placed in a slot inside my particular PC, the analyser code screen is blocked from view and unreadable without slipping a mirror along side to read the codes (in reverse)  When placed in the external port, I couldn't get it to detect power or throw any codes at all.  The one code I could finally read with the analyser in a PCI slot made no sense at all based on my MB  and was in no way related to the actual problem I was having which turned out to be a bad power module.  Might work for some...but not for me.

instruction: Given an Amazon review, indicate whether it is a 'Positive Review' or 'Negative Review'.
input:
I went through my drawers recently and discovered that while I had a great many USB sticks, many of them were quite old. Old enough that several had storage capacities measured in megabytes. But I was loathe to get rid of them - after all, you never know when you'll need one, right?

So the deal I cut with myself was that I'd get a small set of cheap modern sticks and dispose of the old ones. I had expected the best bargain to be some no-name brand made of cheapo plastic, but the price on these was competitive, and (having seen them before) I knew the quality to be first rate.

So, now my drawers have a bit less clutter, I have one of these on my keychain and a handful more on hand for when I need them. They've been great.

instruction: Given an Amazon review, indicate whether it is a 'Positive Review' or 'Negative Review'.
input: Whatever you do, don't waste your money. It was great at first, and I read the other reviews saying it didn't hold a charge but my kids can't have a lot of screen time anyway so I didn't mind that. But what they meant by"didn't hold a charge" was that after a while the table itself just won't charge. My kids hardly ever played with them and never around food or drink. One day it was charging, the next day it was dead. I thought it was the charger until the same charger was working for my phone just fine and the tablet still want charging on a different charger. We tried moving the chargers at various angles but nothing seemed to work. Don't waste your money.

instruction: Given an Amazon review, indicate whether it is a 'Positive Review' or 'Negative Review'.
input: Windows XP was 32 bit, Windows 7 made the transition and had 32 bit and 64 bit versions.  32 bit can access 2.19 TB of a single hard disk.  Thus a 3 TB or larger cannot be fully used by a 32 bit system.  But, it does not end there.  You can have Windows 7 or 8 running in 64 bit mode and not use but 2.19 TB if your Bios on your computer is 32 bit.  When you install you will be given the option to format the drive for LBA which is 32 bit or GPT which is 64 bit.  If you use GPT and your Bios is not been upgraded from 32 bit to 64 bit then your computer will not be able to mount the Hard disk.  In which case you will have to start over and select LBA and run 32 bit unless you can upgrade your bios.  The disks are good!  It is your operating system (such as XP or Win 7 32 bit) or it is your bios that may limit you.  Hope this helps.

instruction: Given an Amazon review, indicate whether it is a 'Positive Review' or 'Negative Review'.
input: I purchased this computer on behalf of my jr. higher, who had saved up and researched laptops good for gaming.  We bought it June 26, 2012, it started overheating and crashing in late March of 2013.  We purchased a cooling pad in April, thinking this would resolve the issue, it did not. Busy with the combination of school finals and traveling, I tried contacting the seller, ELECTRONIC777 in June (before our 1 yr. exp. date) and they said there was nothing they could do and to go to Dell directly. I contacted Dell, went through diagnostic testing, they confirmed there may be a faulty part, but could not advice me any further since the 1 yr warranty on the laptop expired in Jan 2013, because that was the purchase date they had on record.  They recommended I contact the seller since the seller should be obligated to honor the 1 yr. warranty I had understood it to have.  I contacted ELECTRONIC777 and they basically verified I was suppose to have a 1 yr. warranty, but it was Dell's responsibility and were ABSOLUTELY no help, in fact instead of helping me as one of their customers, it felt like they were basically giving me the finger and saying it's your problem.  I tried contacting Amazon, thinking they would step in on my behalf having records of my purchase date and the fact that I was indeed suppose to have a 1 yr. warranty.  I filled out all the requested information and they sent me an email saying it did not fall into the A-Z Guarantee.  Ok, glad they're there to protect their consumers, shame on you amazon.  So here I am with a laptop that is barely a year old does not work for more than 20 min without crashing, a seller who won't help me, and a 1 yr. warranty that was only honored for 7 months.  I'm still trying to haggle this out with Dell, but something is VERY wrong with the whole system, BUYER'S BEWARE.  I would never buy from this seller, ELECTRONIC777 again.

instruction: Given an Amazon review, indicate whether it is a 'Positive Review' or 'Negative Review'.
